strategy: Replace the neural network with a stacked autoencoder (autoencoder-based feature learning) to perform unsupervised feature extraction on the raw input data. Use the latent space of the autoencoder as input to a simple logistic regression model. This leverages autoencoders to learn compressed, non-linear representations of the data, which may capture latent patterns missed by dense layers. Apply time-based train/validation splits and use class weighting with stratified sampling. This approach focuses on discovering hidden structure in the data without relying on explicit feature engineering.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
numerical_columns = ['Age', 'Fare', 'Pclass', 'SibSp', 'Parch']

# Combine all features
X_train = train_df[numerical_columns + categorical_columns]
X_test = test_df[numerical_columns + categorical_columns]

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Align columns
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_encoded)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_encoded)

# Time-based split (since data is historical)
train_split, val_split, _, _ = train_test_split(X_train_scaled, train_df['Survived'], test_size=0.2, random_state=42, stratify=train_df['Survived'])

# Train autoencoder (using only neural network layers, no external libraries needed for basic implementation)
# Autoencoder: 2 hidden layers with 100 and 50 units, then reconstruct

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
numerical_columns = ['Age', 'Fare', 'Pclass', 'SibSp', 'Parch']

# Combine all features
X_train = train_df[numerical_columns + categorical_columns]
X_test = test_df[numerical_columns + categorical_columns]

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Align columns
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_encoded)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test_encoded)

# Time-based split (since data is historical)
train_split, val_split, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train_scaled, train_df['Survived'], test_size=0.2, random_state=42, stratify=train_df['Survived'])
